title: END OF LESSON REVIEW (Unit 9: Review of Task 1 reports)
content: Academic IELTS Unit 09 W: Review of Task 1 reports

questions.instructions:
Part A:

This is the title of a Task 1 graph.

Average amount of electricity used over a two week period in four different countries in Europe.

Read the introductory sentences below and decide which descriptions are most suitable. Select the correct answers.

NOTE: There is no graph for this exercise
questions.question: The graph shows how energy is used over 14 days in four European countries.
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Read the task title carefully and compare it with the introductory sentence.
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! This introductory sentence is incorrect because it is not accurate. The task title does not mention how energy is used over 14 days in four European countries, only the average amount used.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Incorrect. This introductory sentence is incorrect because it is not accurate. The task title does not mention how energy is used over 14 days in four European countries, only the average amount used.

questions.instructions:
Part B:

Look at the essay describing the line graph. Complete the sentences by dragging the correct words to the centre of the boxes to the right (let go when you see a yellow box appear).

Sort elements: lowest, salaries, moderately, stable, peaking, lower, higher, significantly
questions.question: Complete the following sentences:
field_labels: 1. The graph illustrates the relationship between minimum wage and average ________ in four locations over a 60 year period.
2. The UK started as the ________ of the 4 countries, minimum wage being only 20% of average earnings in 1940.
3. However, it experienced the most dramatic increase of all countries from 1950 to 1960, ________ in 1970 at just under 40%, and thereafter returning to the lowest position.
4. Australia increased ________ until 1970, after which New Zealand and Australia remained relatively close.
5. New Zealand remained fairly ________ throughout, starting and finishing at approximately the same level of around 42%.
6. The USA was the highest for most of the period, peaking at about 50%, although it finished at a ________ level than New Zealand.
7. From 1980 onwards, the USA shared a similar trend with the UK, though at a ________ level.
8. Overall, the UK remained ________ lower than the other three countries, and by the end New Zealand, Australia and the USA were at a similar level.
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You completed all the sentences correctly.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the graph and the context of each sentence to choose the most appropriate word.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answers are shown above. Review how each word fits grammatically and contextually in the sentences.

questions.instructions:
Part C:

Look at the notes below. Do they refer to 1950 or 1990? Select the correct answers.
questions.question: Holidays longer than 2 weeks added up to 20%
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data for both years to determine when holidays longer than 2 weeks totaled 20%.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This note refers to 1990.
Correct! This note refers to 1990.

questions.options:
This note refers to 1950
This note refers to 1990

questions.question: More than 4 weeks minority (2%)
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data for both years to determine when holidays of more than 4 weeks were at 2%.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! This sentence refers to 1950.
Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1950.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.question: More than 1 month grew by 5%
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when holidays of more than 1 month increased by 5%.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1990.
Correct! This sentence refers to 1990.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.question: S America/Asia least visited destinations
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when South America and Asia were the least visited destinations.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! This sentence refers to 1950.
Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1950.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when holidays between 1 & 2 weeks were just under 1/3.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! This sentence refers to 1950.
Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1950.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.question: Less than one week remained almost the same
questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when holidays less than one week remained almost the same.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1990.
Correct! This sentence refers to 1990.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when visits to Asia and South America changed by these amounts.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1990.
Correct! This sentence refers to 1990.

questions.options:
This sentence refers to 1950
This sentence refers to 1990

questions.no_answer_feedback: Please select an answer. Review the data to determine when almost ¾ of holidays were in Europe.

Incorrect. This sentence refers to 1950.

questions.instructions:
Part D:

Using the data you can see in the graph, complete the missing information in the Task 1 report. All answers should be written as a single number (e.g. ONE, TEN, FIFTH, not '1', '2' etc). Type your answers in the spaces provided.

The data shows the duration of international vacations and places visited by British tourists in 1950 and 1990.
questions.question: Complete the Task 1 report with the correct number words:
field_labels: In 1950, the majority of holidays were less than one week; just under one ________ were one to two weeks.
Holidays over 4 weeks were in the minority at ________ percent.
Almost ________ quarters of holidays were taken in Europe
and less than ________ tenth in South America and Asia combined. They were the least visited destinations.
In 1990, the percentage of holidays less than one week remained steady with just a ________ percent decrease.
There was a ________ percent fall in holidays of one to two weeks,
yet holidays longer than this accounted for one ________
as opposed to less than a ________ in 1950.

There was an inverse correlation between the increasing percentage of people who went abroad for over two weeks and the percentage who visited Europe. The percentage of visitors to Asia more than doubled and to South America more than tripled. Overall, Europe remained the most visited destination even though visitors declined by ________ five percent over the period shown.
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You completed the report correctly.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Check the data carefully and make sure to write numbers as words (e.g., ONE, not '1').
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answers are shown above. Make sure to write numbers as words in your Task 1 reports.
